page.title: 11HOUSING IN THORNER (1)
page.content:
The older housing (besides farm buildings), is found along Main Street. There is an estate of post Second World War housing behind St. Peter's church.
The majority of houses on Main Street appear to have been built between 1700 and 1850. There are some infills between, these dating from Victorian times to post second world war. Building materials of the oldest and newest houses tend to be stone walls and slate roofs, though there are red brick Victorian houses too.
Many houses are terraced, or linked to the house next door, even though they date from different periods.
{more>>}
